MultiD_RD_functions module

MultiD_RD_functions.multid_rdf(particles_1, particles_2, r_max, dr, boxdims=[[0.0, 0.0], [132.0, 132.0]], rho=None, eps=1e-15, parallel=True, progress=False)

Computes 2D or 3D radial distribution function g(r) of a set of particle coordinates of shape (N, d). Particle must be placed in a 2D or 3D cuboidal box of dimensions [width x height (x depth)].

Parameters:

  • particles_1 ((N, d) np.array) – Set of particles from which to compute the radial distribution function g(r) with respect to particles_2. Must be of shape (N, 2) or (N, 3) for 2D and 3D coordinates repsectively.

  • particles_2 ((N, d) np.array) – Set of particles from which the rdf will be computed with respect to particles_1. Must be of shape (N, 2) or (N, 3) for 2D and 3D coordinates repsectively.

  • r_max (float) – Max radius over which g(r) is computed.

  • dr (float) – dr over which g(r) steps are computed

  • boxdims ((n, 2) np.array) – Dimensions of box, default ([[0., 132.], [0., 132.]])

  • rho (float, optional) – Number density. If left as None, box dimensions will be inferred from the particles and the number density will be calculated accordingly.

  • eps (float, optional) – Epsilon value used to find particles less than or equal to a distance in KDTree.

  • parallel (bool, optional) – Option to enable or disable multiprocessing. Enabling this affords significant increases in speed.

  • progress (bool, optional) – Set to False to disable progress readout (only valid when parallel=False).

Returns:

  • g_r ((n_radii) np.array) – radial distribution function values g(r).

  • radii ((n_radii) np.array) – radii over which g(r) is computed

MultiD_RD_functions.paralell_hist_loop(radii_and_indices, kdtree, particles, mins, maxs, N_radii, dr, eps, rho)

RDF histogram loop process for multiprocessing
